job_title: RN Case Manager in Mentor, OH
pros: Supportive leadership, friendly staff, clean
cons: Under paid, poor annual review/raises. Raises are not based on performance. Everyone gets a raise or no one gets a raise. We do not earn PTO past the 40th hour of work for the week. (If I get six hours of PTO for 40 hour work week I would also get six hours of PTO for a 60 hour work week.) required to use PTO for holiday. Even if you’ve already worked 40 hours for the week if you take a day off you need to claim your full shift hours for the time off. (If my regular workday would’ve been eight hours and I’ve already worked 35 hours that week I took Friday off I’m still obligated to use a full eight hours of PTO.

pros: Friendly coworkers, decent benefits, perfectly fine job
cons: minimal growth opportunities, stubborn doctors, lack of innovation in services

review_title: Not a bad place to work
job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Willoughby, OH
pros: Very good benefits and nice staff
cons: Pay isn't the most competitive

review_title: Great place to feel your part of a family, health benefits not good for hospital
job_title: Consultting Technical Advisor in Willoughby, OH
pros: Small community hospital that makes you feel like family.  Better pay then big hospitals like Cleveland Clinic and UH.  More friend work schedules.  Great doctors you do not have to wait two to three months to see and another three months and then 6 months later finally have surgery.  Lake is great at serving their patients.
cons: For being a hospital the health benefits are not very good.  Only covers at 90% with a decent high deductible.  They do not do enough events to honor their employees or do fun discounts often for employees.  ER is very slow

pros: I love the atmosphere and friendly coworkers at the Tripoint facility.  The campus is a newer hospital with up to date equipment.  The grounds are beautiful.  The physicians are easy to work with and most staff has an easy going attitude.
cons: Raises are slow in coming, insurance costs raise yearly, but overall benefits are competitive for a community hospital. Staffing for floor nurses is tight.

review_title: Started out as a terrific employment but this changed after new hospital was built.
job_title: Phlebotomist, MLT, Medical Assistant in Madison, OH
pros: If you have a decent boss, you are great. Many long term employees, who are now unhappy with Lake.
cons: Management-Upper management- is the main problem. They are so worried about money. They get rid of long-term employees to reduce the higher wages and higher PTO rate that these employees have earned.

review_title: Patient and Doc's enjoyable, salary and freezes not so good
pros: Doc's and Pt's a really treat.  Clean office with good supplies.  Friendly faces and kind people.  Did not mind going to work for those reasons.
cons: Financially not a good place to work.  To many freezes on salary and PTO.   Does not pay well and will not move up in pay.

review_title: Coworkers are awesome, dangerous nurse to patient ratios.
pros: Coworkers are wonderful, your pay check won’t bounce.
cons: Not safe for Nurses, staffing ratios are dangerous. If you care about your license I wouldn’t recommend working here. For example, the RN who has the trauma rooms will also have all of the psych patients. You will end up being the only RN in the clinical decision unit because they will take your aide and you will be left there alone on the unit to fend for yourself. Management thinks this is perfectly acceptable and safe.

pros: Small hospital system, you're not just a face in a crowd.  Extremely patient/family care oriented.  CEO actually is a nurse, not a business bureaucrat.
cons: Small hospital, does not take in tons of money.  Pay is slightly below average, all departments run with fewest employees possible, constantly thinly staffed.  Software and general fixtures need updating.

review_title: Be prepared to be on your feet all day running around like a chicken with your head cut off.
pros: They offer opportunity to pick up overtime often. Also offer “bonus” (essentially time and a half) when staff is very low. Which depending on time of year can be quite often as well.
cons: Can get overwhelming. A lot of patients to take care of. Usually 12 patients but can go up to 24 if they are short staffed. This happens most often on night shift.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Willoughby, OH
pros: Lake health is a great health care organization to work for that helps patients and their health.  This organization is filled with very special and compassionate people.
cons: It is a competitive organization to work for with all of the other health care organizations out there. The salaries and health care is in constant battle.

review_title: My experience working at Lake Health Hospital it had so Pro's and Con's but it is not a bad place to work at
pros: I Enjoy working side by side with the nurses and help taking of patients.
cons: I did not enjoy the long 12 hours shift 12 hours fast pace job so very exhausting plus some of the nurses was not helpful

pros: Closer to home, Lake Health is a big part of the community that I live in, friendly people who are dedicated to the job.
cons: So busy, barely time to breath.  Low wages, expensive benefits, department so tight you can't get basic office supplies.  They gave me old, broken supplies, so I purchased my own; out of my own pocket.

pros: Flexible Schedule, Paid Time Off, Free Parking
cons: Floated Frequently to Other Units, Lack of Management Support, Short Staffed

pros: I really liked that they had you shadow during the interviewing process so that you knew exactly what you were applying for.
cons: I did not like that for orientation I was told a different time than what was on the schedule so I was 45 minutes early

pros: Cant think of one thing
cons: Hipsters running the financial dept right into the ground!

pros: Good pay and benefits. Unlike other social work jobs, you do not have to take your work home, which is a huge plus! So work/life balance is actually achievable.
cons: Like any organization there will be great people you work with, and others not so great.p

review_title: Overall impression of Lake Health hospital system
pros: It's a smaller Hospital system, so in order to attract NP's to come and work there, they offer great salaries.
cons: Not much room for advancement.

pros: The position is very hands off. Our calls are not recorded and it is entrusted that we provide the best customer service.

cons: Specialist choose if they want to come in to see the patient. If they don't want to then you are out of luck. Always short nurses and doctors.
